page.title: 19Clubs - Staffordshire
page.content: The Staffordshire side of the area has both a Church and a Village Hall in different parts of Mayfield for use by Clubs. There is a playgroup, a Brownie Pack and a Womens Institute. Men have a Tug-of-War team and the Mens Institute, also a social games club - with its own hall for billiards. The Ladies Group is an informal social gathering and there is also a Senior Social Club. The Church runs a Mothers and Tots Club, a Church Youth Club for the 10-12 year olds and the Church Women's Fellowship, once called the Mothers Union. The well known trout fishing on the River Dove is let to about four different clubs. These are privately run and attract both local members and fishermen from further away.
